header.title: Gogglebox fans call for Ellie and Izzie Warner to be removed after problematic jokes and #MeToo game
header.postText: Fans of Gogglebox were left disgusted after Ellie Warner admitted she and her friends made up a ‘tag’ game called #MeToo.', 'Viewers expressed their disgust when Ellie, 28, and her sister Izzie talked about the last time they had played the playground game ‘tag’, with Ellie admitting she had recently played a modified version of the game.', 'The adult version of the game involved her and her friends chasing each other around and grabbing each other’s ‘boobs or bum’ and calling out ‘me too’ when caught.', 'Fans took to Twitter to rant about her problematic game, writing: ‘Can’t actually believe that woman on Gogglebox taking the p**s of the Me Too movement with her pals, chasing and grabbing each other’s breasts and shouting “me too” whenever they caught each other.’', 'Another added: ‘Ellie making a “joke” about the me too movement… after the way she treated her dog, why is she still on?’', 'Izzie also came under fire for Friday’s episode after she suggested Boris Johnson should have ‘shoved his k**b in her gob to shut her up’ after being questioned by a woman.', 'Viewers wrote: ‘Those sisters are disgusting. One suggests sticking a k**b in a gob to shut someone up and the other makes a grab a boob game out of the me too movement. They should be pulled off air. I don’t offend easily but those two are vile.’', 'Another added: ‘The two sisters on #Gogglebox are so annoying. Why are they still on the show? Who makes a game out of #MeToo? Ellie just come across as stupid. Both sisters think it’s clever to say such stupid stuff to get headlines.’', 'Me Too is the movement against sexual harassment and assault which went viral in 2017 to demonstrate how common sexual assault and harassment is, particularly in the workplace.
header.socioLingVar: Gender - General,Age - Youngsters,Gender - Female sexuality,Age - Over 65s

commentThread.commentText: They're not the sharpest tools in the box.
just think people are too over sensitive .

replies.commentText: Yeah rape survivors are known for being over sensitive. Maybe they should just turn of the TV huh?
Kimbo It's reality TV. It's meant to reflect what real people say. If you want a sanitised, censored dialogue, there are plenty of other programs available.
Arnold Hedge there's no "reality" in reality TV. Rape jokes aren't funny at all. Anywhere. Ever.
Nanny Kimbo No but MeToo is.
Crimbo You might not find them funny, but nobody appointed you as the arbiter of what is and is not funny.

I worry about the direction society is heading. Look at how pathetic people are for getting 'offended' over something as trival as this.Give it another 5 years and people will be getting 'offended' if you ask them the time.
Nanny Kimbo i am a victim, but i still; have tollerance of silly comments made that are not intended too cause offence
Nanny Kimbo It was not a joke about Rape ffs

commentThread.commentText: Unfortunately for a lot of people in their protected bubble-wrapped worlds, they don't realise this is how people speak and think outside their sphere. I'm glad such diversity exists in the world.

replies.commentText: I thought it was funny. I mean... funny in a wrong way and not a game I would play but if anything they are making light of a situation of some people calling out claims when at the time they just accepted it.But I think for many people love to be seen to be offended to look superior.

commentThread.commentText: People getting upset over them in my opinion mocking the fake metoo claims. People need to get a thicker skin ffs.
The whole premise of this program is that it's people in their own homes. This is what people do. Telling off colour jokes is quite normal and it's delusional to pretend that it isn't.
I personally find their voices very droney and irritating and cant watch them
Seriously have some people not got anything better to moan about than the girls in Goggle box get of your high horse for god sake   😡

There's been a large number of people that have had they're lives ruined by the Me Too movement with no evidence whatsoever. The movement is a bit a joke because of this.A recent axample being Zoe Quinn Me Tooing a game developer with no evidence to speak of; everyone he knew disowned him, his place of work fired him and his friends publicly condemned him. Everyone believed this woman, a known liar, and he committed suicide because of it.

replies.commentText: There's also a significant number of people who've had their lives ruined by sexual harrssment and / or rape.The example you cite is a good one, however, although I think it's not quite as cut and dried as "innocent person committed suicide due to false allegations". [LINK] saying you don't have a point - just that it's a complicated issue sometimes.
